front.title: The Base16, Base32, and Base64 Data Encodings

abstract.t: This document describes the commonly used base 64, base 32, and base 16 encoding schemes. It also discusses the use of line-feeds in encoded data, use of padding in encoded data, use of non-alphabet characters in encoded data, use of different encoding alphabets, and canonical encodings. This document obsoletes RFC 4648 and changes the status to Internet Standard.
